item.title: How We Created a Realtime Patient Monitoring System With Go and Vue in 3 days
item.description: A Pandemic started In the last November in 2019, we heard about the first case of unknown deadly diseases from China. Now everyone knows it as Covid-19 Now it seems to change our lives forever. The virus is deadly and it is highly contagious. Still, we know very little about it. I truly hope we will find some cure soon. Corona Virus Covid-19 attacked Sri Lanka Due to the nature of the virus, it was very hard to stop it from spreading.
item.author: (Kasun Vithanage)

item.title: Awk in 20 Minutes
item.description: Awk is a tiny programming language and a command line tool. It's particularly appropriate for log parsing on servers, mostly because Awk will operate on files, usually structured in lines of human-readable text.

item.title: Complexity Has to Live Somewhere
item.description: We try to get rid of the complexity, control it, and seek simplicity. I think framing things that way is misguided. Complexity has to live somewhere. Embrace it

item.title: Reducing allocations using Span<T> and Memory<T>
item.description: I decided to look at the RabbitMQ .NET Client source code to make improvements. During that exploration I saw opportunities to reduce memory allocations.
item.author: (Stefán Jökull Sigurðarson)

item.title: Endorse COVIDSafe
item.description: Together we can keep Australia safe

item.title: on the usability of editable software
item.description: I’m aware of two occasions on which Knuth advised editing existing code, as opposed to simply using it. One mention is in this interview, advocating for “re-editable” code instead of the fashionable reusable code, although it doesn’t amount to much more than that statement. In Coders at Work he describes a system of working that’s basically patch and diff. He writes a program, the master version that works for him, and ships it out. People receive and it and then modify it with change files so it works for them.

item.title: Gatsby and Sanity - Part 4 (Live Stream)
item.description:
Gatsby and Sanity.io are a great pair for creating JAMstack projects like blogs. In these videos, I am working to migrate my Gatsby blog from using markdown files to using the Headless CMS called Sanity.io. After starting this migration, I am loving Gatsby and Sanity.io
https://www.jamesqquick.com https://www.jamesqquick.com/uses/ (hardware, software, etc.) https://twitch.tv/jamesqquick https://www.learnbuildteach.com/
Learn everything you need to know about Visual Studio Code!! https://www.udemy.com/learn-visual-studio-code/
Build a Quiz App with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript - https://www.udemy.com/build-a-quiz-app-with-html-css-and-javascript/

item.author: (James Q Quick)

item.title: Open file links directly in Office desktop apps
item.description: Some users prefer the Office web apps, others prefer the Office desktop apps. We've designed an experience where users get to tell us what they prefer, and then their links open in their preferred mode - either Office web apps or the Office desktop apps.
